intro: Leptosiphon liniflorus, commonly known as the slender-flowered sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant produces small, linear leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It blooms during the summer months and is adapted to full sun exposure, making it a hardy species in arid environments.
